artist: Manufacturer: P.A. Geier Company (now Royal Appliance Manufacturing Company)
creditline: Gift of Various Donors, by exchange
description: red bullet-shaped body with chrome detail; black handle and stand; "Royal" on side
dimension: 10 1/8 x 6 3/4 x 25 in. (25.72 x 17.15 x 63.5 cm) (single element, vacuum canister only)
medium: Steel, chrome, plastic, braided cloth, electrical components
text: Resembling a torpedo, bullet or rocket sled, this electrifying design looks as if it can propel itself around the house. Touted as a “complete, highly perfected home cleaning system,” this Royal model is “designed and built to clean and renovate everything in the home more thoroughly and efficiently.” A fairly big assignment for such a small machine, but the user had several updated advantages, including disposable bags for dirt capture (“No more flying dust”) and a toe-operated off-on switch at top rear. The hose for tools attached at the front, and the “nose” snapped off easily for dust bag removal.
title: Royal canister vacuum, model 290-A
